unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Gas Cylinder Prices Pinching Pockets Again!**
normalised: **Energy and Utilities: Gas Cylinder Prices Pinching Pockets Again!**

unnormalised: Oi, folks! Looks like the aam aadmi's budget is taking another hit. Gas cylinder prices are up again, as usual. Sources say the latest hike adds another Rs. 50 to your cooking bill. That means a cylinder in Delhi will now cost you around Rs. 1150. Chai-pakora nights just got pricier, eh?
normalised: Oi, folks! Looks like the aam aadmi's budget is taking another hit. Gas cylinder prices are up again, as usual. Sources say the latest hike adds another rupee fifty to your cooking bill. That means a cylinder in Delhi will now cost you around rupee one thousand one hundred and fifty. Chai-pakora nights just got pricier, eh?

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from the Indian Oil Corporation says global supply chain issues are to blame. Right. We've heard that before. This is the third hike in as many months.
normalised: Doctor Sharma from the Indian Oil Corporation says global supply chain issues are to blame. Right. We've heard that before. This is the third hike in as many months.

unnormalised: Remember when prices were supposed to stay stable after Diwali? Yeah, well, that aged like milk left out in the Mumbai sun.
normalised: Remember when prices were supposed to stay stable after Diwali? Yeah, well, that aged like milk left out in the Mumbai sun.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Aunty Shanti next door is already complaining about how she'll afford her monthly rations now. Guess we'll all be eating more dal and less paneer tikka masala.
normalised: Meanwhile, Aunty Shanti next door is already complaining about how she'll afford her monthly rations now. Guess we'll all be eating more dal and less paneer tikka masala.

unnormalised: Experts are suggesting people consider biogas or solar alternatives to curb reliance. Good luck installing that in your 500 sq ft Mumbai flat, right? Let's see how long this pinching keeps going on.
normalised: Experts are suggesting people consider biogas or solar alternatives to curb reliance. Good luck installing that in your five hundred square feet Mumbai flat, right? Let's see how long this pinching keeps going on.
